title: Bronze Age society and horse riding in Northern Spain, 2300-1500 BC
abstractText: Many modern research questions in Archaeology can really only be answered through excavation, yet published studies of Bronze Age settlements of the period between 2300-1500 BC are absolutely rare in western Europe. My excavation at Majaladares gained valuable data about horse riding in a subsistence economy that thrived around 2000 BC on the dry lands of Spain. They will help to invigorate debates about physical mobility, the rise and decline of pastoral modes of exploitations, and the eventual appearance of mounted warrior aristocracies across the whole field of later European prehistory.
